page.title: 06RIVERS
page.content: There are only two rivers running through our area. The shorter of the two rivers is the Bain, which is said to be the shortest named river in England. The larger river is the Ure. The bed of the Bain is very stony, but the bed of the Ure is smooth in places. The rivers run over limestone beds and, as a consequence, there are many waterfalls, known as "forces". The Bain starts at Semerwater, which is a glacial lake, and runs for two miles,flowing through Bainbridge and meeting the Ure to the north of the village, passing a water-powered joinery workshop and a renovated water-mill. Both locals and visitors enjoy fishing especially for trout and crayfish, although, at present, unusually heavy weed growth is de-oxygenating the water.
